choices.D:
Add a row in the Assets sheet in Config.xlsx with the name of the Orchestrator asset.
In the login workflow, retrieve the username and password by referencing the Config dictionary.
choices.B:
Add a row in the Settings sheet in Config.xlsx with the name of the Orchestrator asset.
Use the Get Credential activity in the login workflow to retrieve the username and password.
choices.C:
Add a row in the Assets sheet in Config.xlsx with the name of the Orchestrator asset.
Use the Get Credential activity in the login workflow to get the username and password.
choices.A:
Add a row in the Constants sheet in Config.xlsx with the name of the Orchestrator asset.
Use the Get Credential activity in the login workflow to get the username and password.

questions.question_text:
A developer used the Robotic Enterprise (RE) Framework to implement an automation of a website. For security reasons, the credentials for the login are stored in the Orchestrator.
Which steps should the developer perform to use these credentials in the project?

DRAG DROP -
In a Robotic Enterprise (RE) Framework project that is connected to Orchestrator, what is the correct sequence of steps if an application exception occurs on a Queue Item in the Process Transaction state?
NOTE: Drag the Description found on the “Left” and drop on the correct Step Sequence found on the “Right”.
//IMG//

discussion.content:
1. Set Transaction Status to "Failed" and take a screenshot
2. Close All Applications or kill Applications
3. Execute the Initialization State
4. Process another Queue Item, if one exists.

Set Transaction Status to Failed (Invoke SetTransactionStatus)
Take Screenshot (SetTransactionStatus → System Exception Path ->Try taking screenshot )
Close All Appn or Kill all appn (SetTransactionStatus → System Exception Path → Try closing applications )
Execute Initialization State
Process Another Queue Item, if one exist

comments.content: should be take screenshot first if you look closely in set transaction status first invoked is take screenshot then below it the set transaction status activity to failed. Aside from that the sequence is correct

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A developer wants to use the Robotic Enterprise (RE) Framework to automate a business process. The TransactionData of this process is a collection(List<String>) of vendor names.
From the drop-down list shown in the exhibit, select the variable type for the TransactionItem.
//IMG//

discussion.content:
correct answer is String

TransactionData → TransactionItem

DataTable → DataRow
Array of String → String
Array of Integers → Integer
List of String → String
String → Charcter
Etc…
String
String is correct answer

choices.A: Use a Retry Scope activity within the Process Transaction state
choices.D: Create a Queue in Orchestrator with the "Max # of retries" greater than 0
choices.B: Use a Try Catch activity with a Retry Scope activity in the Catch block defined for Application Exceptions
choices.C: Set the MaxRetryNumber in the Config.xlsx file to a number greater than 0

questions.question_text: A process uses the Robotic Enterprise (RE) Framework without access to Orchestrator. Based on best practices, what is the recommended way to ensure a transaction will be retried in the event of an Application Exception while processing that transaction?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C, open config file and read definition of MaxRetryNumber in constants sheet

Selected Answer: C
C. Set the MaxRetryNumber in the Config.xlsx file to a number greater than 0

Selected Answer: B
Option B is correct

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C, open config file and read definition of MaxRetryNumber in constants sheet

Selected Answer: C
MaxRetryNumber in Config -- Must be 0 if working with Orchestrator queues. If > 0, the robot will retry the same transaction which failed with a system exception. Must be an integer value.

comments.content: isnt application exception and system exception similar?
Sorry the correct answer is C !

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
MaxRetryNumbe is for System Exception.

Remove the OrchestratorQueueName setting from Config.xlsx

questions.question_text: A developer wants to use the default Robotic Enterprise (RE) Framework without using Orchestrator. What is the minimum requirement to ensure that the project does not access Orchestrator queues?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C seems to be correct. The ReFramework without Queues checklist PDF in the academy training states: Delete the Get transaction item activity (of type UiPath.Core.Activities.GetQueueItem); also, it says in the annotation on the Get transaction activity: "If queues are not used in this process, replace this activity with the appropriated logic to retrieve transaction items."

comments.content: Actually, C seems to be correct. The ReFramework without Queues checklist PDF in the academy training states: Delete the Get transaction item activity (of type UiPath.Core.Activities.GetQueueItem); also, it says in the annotation on the Get transaction activity: "If queues are not used in this process, replace this activity with the appropriated logic to retrieve transaction items."

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Locate the Invoke SetTransactionStatus (Success) activity and open the Arguments
list; locate the entry for the in_TransactionItem argument and change the value (not
the data type!) from TransactionItem to Nothing;
Locate the Invoke SetTransactionStatus (BRE) activity and do the same change as
the previous one;
Locate the Invoke SetTransactionStatus (SE) activity and do the same change as
the previous one.

Selected Answer: D
D is enough as minimum requirement
